sources: Oxford/Yale AI expert survey (2017) – AI expected to outperform humans at truck driving by 2027
TuSimple 2021 pilot – first 80-mile driverless truck run on public roads
reasoning: Low current AI adoption (~5%) reflects limited Level 4 autonomous freight in operation; expert surveys point to 2027 for parity, and widespread platooning/autonomous convoys by 2025 for partial automation.

sources: WEF Future of Jobs 2025 – light truck/delivery drivers remain in demand despite early automation pilots
Emerging drone and Nuro robot delivery pilots indicate slow roll-out as of 2025
reasoning: Very low AI presence now (<5%) because urban “last-mile” is complex; incremental gains (5%+) by 2030 from sidewalk bots and drones, but full driver-free vans remain decades away (2035).

sources: WEF Future of Jobs 2025 – self-checkout growth drives ~30% automation today
NACS 2024 report – cashierless stores (Amazon Go, etc.) expanding to ~60% of large-format retailers by 2028
reasoning: Self-checkout and cashierless stores account for ~30% now; by 2028 most large chains will offer fully unattended checkout (~60%), with near-universal deployment by 2030.

sources: Gartner 2021 – AI handled ~70% of routine inquiries by 2022

reasoning: Conversational AI handles 25% of interactions today; by 2025 most FAQs and status queries will be fully automated, and by 2029 advanced emotional-AI systems will replace most live agents.

sources: WEF Future of Jobs 2025 – routine data tasks nearly entirely automated

reasoning: Structured data entry is already ~90% automated with RPA; by 2025 end-to-end AI/RPA workflows will cover ~98% of those tasks, leaving minimal human oversight.
